item.title: Kanji of the Day: 丁
item.description:
丁

✍2

小3

street, ward, town, counter for guns, tools, leaves or cakes of something, even number, 4th calendar sign

チョウ　テイ　チン　トウ　チ

ひのと

丁寧   (ていねい)   —   polite
丁目   (ちょうめ)   —   district of a town
包丁   (ほうちょう)   —   kitchen knife
装丁   (そうてい)   —   binding (book)
一丁   (いっちょう)   —   one sheet
八丁   (はっちょう)   —   skillfulness
長丁場   (ながちょうば)   —   long (stretch of) distance
丁重   (ていちょう)   —   polite
横丁   (よこちょう)   —   bystreet
胸突き八丁   (むなつきはっちょう)   —   the most trying spot or period
柳刃包丁   (やなぎばぼうちょう)   —   kitchen knife for sashimi
丁稚   (でっち)   —   apprentice
丁々発止   (ちょうちょうはっし)   —   of clashing swords
丁度   (ちょうど)   —   just
丁字路   (ていじろ)   —   T junction
符丁   (ふちょう)   —   mark
丁字   (ちょうじ)   —   clove
丁寧語   (ていねいご)   —   polite language (i.e., masu, desu, etc.)
庖丁   (ほうちょう)   —   kitchen knife
沈丁花   (じんちょうげ)   —   winter daphne (Daphne odora)

This page was generated using kanjioftheday, written by Douglas Paul Perkins. Kanji lists came from the Ministry of Education. Example words are derived from a word frequency list by Alexandre Girardi. Dictionary information is taken from KANJIDIC2 and EDICT.
